messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that move around the Sun, at least 140 metres wide. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size, and so far, they have recorded about 8,000, which means 17,000 are still not found. Because a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk in 2013 and injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they come close to Earth.
Feedback received: Grade 7/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as B2 likely because it uses long, complex sentences and non-restrictive clauses that exceed B1. For example, “NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that move around the Sun, at least 140 metres wide.” embeds extra information in one sentence. The sentence “Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size, and so far, they have recorded about 8,000, which means 17,000 are still not found.” is also lengthy and uses a parenthetical meaning clause. To reach B1, split these into shorter sentences, remove non-restrictive relative clauses, and use simple connectors. For instance, write: “NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids. These asteroids are at least 140 metres wide. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size. So far they have recorded about 8,000. This means they have not yet found 17,000.” Apply the same strategy to the danger sentence by breaking it into two or three simple sentences. These changes will lower sentence complexity and align the text with B1 requirements.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids. An asteroid is a space rock that moves around the Sun. These asteroids are at least 140 metres wide. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size. So far, they have recorded about 8,000. This leaves about 17,000 not yet found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. It injured 1,200 people. For this reason, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 5/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as A2, indicating it is too simple for B1. The output uses many short, independent sentences without connectors or complex structures, for example: "So far, they have recorded about 8,000. This leaves about 17,000 not yet found." and "An asteroid is a space rock that moves around the Sun." These simple sentences and lack of linking words reduce the complexity expected at B1. To meet B1 criteria, combine ideas using conjunctions (for example, use "considering that" or "therefore"), introduce relative clauses (for example, "Scientists, who estimate around 25,000 of this size, have recorded 8,000 so far"), and vary sentence length to improve fluency and cohesion.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids (space rocks that travel around the Sun), which are at least 140 metres wide. Scientists, who estimate there are about 25,000 of this size, have recorded around 8,000 so far, which means that about 17,000 are still not found. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 and injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would therefore be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as "B2" likely because it uses the B2-level word "means" in the phrase "which means that about 17,000 are still not found" and includes a parenthetical clause "(space rocks that travel around the Sun)", creating complex sentence structure. To reach B1 level, replace "which means that" with a simpler conjunction such as "so", rephrase or remove the parenthesis into its own sentence, and shorten long sentences. For example: "Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of this size. They have recorded around 8,000 so far, so about 17,000 are still not found."

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids. An asteroid is a space rock that travels around the Sun. These asteroids are at least 140 metres wide. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of this size. They have recorded around 8,000 so far, so about 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia and injured 1,200 people. Asteroids of this size would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as "B2" rather than the required "B1". The use of structures like "Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of this size" and the conditional modal phrase "would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit" introduce advanced reporting and conditional forms that push the text into B2. To adjust to B1, simplify sentences and verb forms: for example, replace "Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of this size" with "There are about 25,000 asteroids of this size, according to scientists" or simply "There are about 25,000 of these asteroids". Change "would be a serious danger" to "could be very dangerous" or "may be dangerous". Aim for shorter sentences and clear connectors like "so" or "because" to maintain fluency at B1 level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids. An asteroid is a space rock that travels around the Sun. These asteroids are at least 140 metres wide. There are about 25,000 of these asteroids, according to scientists. So far, NASA has recorded around 8,000. This means about 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia and injured 1,200 people. Because of this, asteroids of this size could be very dangerous if they come into Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 5/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as A2 likely because it consists of very short, standalone sentences and lacks the connectors and sentence complexity expected at B1. For example, each idea is in its own sentence: “NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids.” followed by “An asteroid is a space rock that travels around the Sun.” To achieve B1, combine ideas using conjunctions and relative clauses. For instance, merge those two sentences into: “NASA is now working to record some of the smaller asteroids, which are space rocks at least 140 metres wide that travel around the Sun.” Introduce linking words such as however, therefore, and because, and vary sentence length. Reducing isolated definitions and using more complex structures will elevate the text to B1 level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that travel around the Sun and are at least 140 metres wide. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of them; however, so far NASA has recorded only around 8,000, so about 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people, which shows how dangerous even a much smaller object can be. Therefore, these middle-sized asteroids could be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as B2, which means its sentence structures and connectors are too advanced for B1. For example, the sentence “NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that travel around the Sun and are at least 140 metres wide.” uses a non-essential relative clause and multiple phrases in one sentence. The use of a semicolon in “Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of them; however, so far NASA has recorded only around 8,000” and the connector “Therefore” also contribute to higher complexity. To meet B1, split long sentences into shorter ones, replace semicolons with simple conjunctions like and or but, and limit relative clauses. Use basic connectors (and, but, so) and keep each sentence focused on one main idea.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids. An asteroid is a space rock. It travels around the Sun. In this project, NASA looks for asteroids at least 140 metres wide. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of them, but so far NASA has recorded only about 8,000, so around 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded over the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people. This shows that even a smaller object can be dangerous. So these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as A2 rather than the required B1 level. For example, sentences like "An asteroid is a space rock." and "It travels around the Sun." are very short and elementary, pushing the level down to A2. To achieve B1, combine simple sentences into compound or complex ones using connectors like because, which, so, or although. Instead of isolated definitions, integrate explanations into longer sentences. For instance, merge “NASA is now working to record smaller asteroids” with “In this project, NASA looks for asteroids at least 140 metres wide” using a connector. Vary sentence length and structure and introduce more B1-level linking expressions and vocabulary to raise the text’s complexity to the target level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is working to log smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that travel around the Sun, especially those at least 140 metres wide. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 of this size, but so far only around 8,000 have been logged, which means roughly 17,000 are not yet recorded. In 2013, for example, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people, showing that even a relatively small object can be dangerous. Because of this, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as 'B2' likely because of complex sentence structures and high-density information in single sentences. For example, the sentence "NASA is working to log smaller asteroids, which are space rocks that travel around the Sun, especially those at least 140 metres wide." has a non-defining relative clause and multiple ideas packed into one sentence. To reach B1 level, split this into shorter sentences, reduce embedded clauses, and use simpler constructions. For example, write one sentence to define what an asteroid is, then a separate sentence to explain NASA’s logging of those over 140 metres. This will lower the complexity and better match B1 guidelines.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: An asteroid is a small space rock that travels around the Sun. NASA is now working to record the smaller ones. They are focusing on objects that are 140 metres wide or more. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, they have recorded about 8,000. That leaves about 17,000 not yet recorded. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people. This shows that even a small object can be dangerous. Because of this, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 5/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as "A2", meaning it is too simple for a B1 level. The output uses many short, standalone sentences (for example, "NASA is now working to record the smaller ones.") and lacks B1-level linking devices and sentence variety. To reach B1, combine ideas into compound or complex sentences and add connectors such as however, therefore, since, or although. For instance, rewrite "They are focusing on objects that are 140 metres wide or more. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size." as "Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids measuring 140 metres or more, and NASA is now working to record them." Also include relative clauses or modal verbs to increase complexity and fluency.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: An asteroid is a small space rock that travels around the Sun, and NASA is now working to record some of the smaller ones, which are 140 metres wide or more. Scientists estimate that there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size; however, so far only about 8,000 have been recorded, leaving around 17,000 not yet recorded. Since a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk in 2013 and injured 1,200 people, it is clear that even a small object can be dangerous. Therefore, these middle-sized asteroids could be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as "B2" but must be "B1". The sentence "Scientists estimate that there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size; however, so far only about 8,000 have been recorded, leaving around 17,000 not yet recorded." uses a semicolon, multiple clauses, and the connector "however," making it too complex for B1 learners. To correct this, break it into shorter sentences and use simpler connectors. For example: "Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, only about 8,000 have been recorded. That leaves around 17,000 not yet recorded." Also consider simplifying relative clauses like "which are 140 metres wide or more" by moving the measurement into a separate sentence: "These asteroids measure 140 metres wide or more."

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: An asteroid is a small space rock that travels around the Sun. NASA is now working to record some of the smaller ones. These asteroids measure 140 metres wide or more. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, only about 8,000 have been recorded. That leaves around 17,000 not yet recorded. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people. This shows that even a small object can be dangerous. These middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The classifier labeled the text as ‘A2’, which means it is too simple for a B1 level. Most sentences are short and independent, for example: “So far, only about 8,000 have been recorded. That leaves around 17,000 not yet recorded.” Such simple structures keep the overall level in A2. To raise the level to B1, combine ideas with connectors (for example: “So far, only about 8,000 have been recorded, leaving around 17,000 unaccounted for.”), use more varied sentence structures (such as relative clauses: “Asteroids, which are small space rocks orbiting the Sun, can measure 140 metres or more.”), and include B1-level linking words like however, therefore, and although. This will make the text more complex and fluent while preserving its accuracy.
